column3: Nice! I was thinking about a doxygen linter at some point but happy this is part of C++ compilers now.\n\nConcept and code review ACK a4e970adb6de8425025ae3f62fb89d9e27a8ab1f
cr ACK a4e970adb6de8425025ae3f62fb89d9e27a8ab1f: automatic compiler feedback comes sooner and is more reliable than manual reviewer feedback
Approach ACK and nice fixes that this finds. This is handy indeed.

Approach ACK\n\nI think the new flags `-Wdocumentation` and `-Werror=documentation` could have been enabled unconditionally, regardless of whether `--suppress-external-warnings` is used. Similarly to other `-Wfoo` which cause warnings with 3rd party libs and we have enabled unconditionally.

> I think the new flags -Wdocumentation and -Werror=documentation could have been enabled unconditionally, regardless of whether --suppress-external-warnings is used. Similarly to other -Wfoo which cause warnings with 3rd party libs and we have enabled unconditionally.\n\nWe can't do this for the reasons outlined in the PR description.
